items.content_html:
https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=167729

A checklist to help your pull request get merged faster:

  • Summarize your changes
  • Data: link to resources that verify support information (such as browser's docs, changelogs, source control, bug trackers, and tests)
  • Data: if you tested something, describe how you tested with details like browser and version
  • Review the results of the linter and fix problems reported (If you need help, please ask in a comment!)
  • Link to related issues or pull requests, if any
items.title: Added list-style-type string support for Safari 14.1/iOS 14.5

items.content_html:
An engineer on our team noted the following:

  • Intl.Collator collation option is supported in 14.1 https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/267102/webkit
  • Intl.DateTimeFormat fractionalSecondDigits option is supported in 14.1 - https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/266170/webkit
  • Intl.DateTimeFormat#formatRangeToParts is supported in 14.1 https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/269706/webkit
  • Intl.NumberFormat supports currencyDisplay: 'narrowSymbol' in 14.1 https://trac.webkit.org/changeset/266031/webkit
items.title: Safari 14.1 and iOS 14.5 Intl supplemental updates

items.content_html:
Fixes #9768 (and a duplicate issue).

Mirrored to Firefox for Android 79, after the relevant desktop release. This is a bit of a guess, but I don't see any reason to think it would be otherwise, from the original bug: https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1480236.
items.title: Add queueMicrotask support for Firefox for Android

items.content_html: This PR fixes #6218. During my testing, I found that \0xA9 and \xA9 return two different results (xA9 and Â© respectively).
items.title: Rename Hexadecimal escape sequences

items.content_html:
This PR resolves a small issue with the notes for Safari. It mentions that the property only supports the none and skip values, yet skip is not a value, either in Safari or the spec. I believe the note author meant auto, which is included in the spec.

Fixes #6211.
items.title: Fix Safari notes for text-decoration-skip CSS property

items.content_html: This adds https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc8942 as the spec URL for Accept-CH HTTP header. This is latest version as per Feb 2021
items.title: accept-ch HTTP header - update spec URL

items.content_html:
A checklist to help your pull request get merged faster:

  • Summarize your changes

  • removed experimental status

  • Updated FF and FF for Android columns to show that feature has been enabled in 89th version.

  • Data: link to resources that verify support information (such as browser's docs, changelogs, source control, bug trackers, and tests)

We have PerformanceEventTiming enabled in Nightly for over a month now...

  • Link to related issues or pull requests, if any
    Fixes mdn/content#4309
items.title: Modify PerformanceEventTiming table to show it is enabled on FF 89

items.content_html:
There is no âwake-lockâ feature-controlled-policy defined in any current spec, and no âwake-lockâ feature-controlled-policy was ever implemented in any browser. Itâs instead called screen-wake-lock.

So this change renames http.headers.feature-policy.wake-lock to http.headers.feature-policy.screen-wake-lock.

The change also adds a spec URL for the feature.

Related MDN change: mdn/content#4873
items.title: Rename http.headers.feature-policy.wake-lock to screen-wake-lock

items.content_html:
A checklist to help your pull request get merged faster:

  • Summarize your changes

Updated BCD table to reflect:

  • top level await is enabled starting with FF 89.

  • Update experimental feature status to False

  • update FF and FF for Android columns to show that the feature was added in FF version 89 and removed previous notes.

  • Data: link to resources that verify support information (such as browser's docs, changelogs, source control, bug trackers, and tests)

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1681046

  • Link to related issues or pull requests, if any

Fixes mdn/content#4313
items.title: Update BCD to reflect that top level await is enabled starting with FF 89

items.content_html:
There is no spec for the following policy-controlled features:

  • layout-animations
  • legacy-image-formats
  • oversized-images
  • unoptimized-images
  • unsized-media

So this change marks them all standard_track:false.

Related MDN change: mdn/content#4872
Related MDN change: mdn/content#4899
items.title: Mark several Permission Policy features non-standard

items.content_html:
This is part of fixing #10224

WorkerGlobalScope has the (deprecated) onclose() event handler property, but not the associated method close() and event close_event. This copies the event hanlder for the other two items. This then ensures that BCD matches MDN for this property.
items.title: WorkerGlobalScope - add close() and close_event to match onclose()

items.content_html:
Fixes #10271.

URL scheme-aware (schemeful) SameSite support was enabled by default in Chrome 89 and Chrome for Android 89, per Chrome Platform Status: https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5096179480133632

I wasn't sure if I should keep the support statements for Chrome 86 when it was available via a flag, but it seems like that's unnecessary. Please let me know if I'm wrong and I'll fix it.
items.title: Mark "URL scheme-aware (schemeful) SameSite cookies" supported in Chrome 89

items.content_html:
This PR adds real values for Internet Explorer and Edge for the WorkerGlobalScope API, based upon results from the mdn-bcd-collector project (v3.0.2). Results are manually confirmed for accuracy.

Tests Used: https://mdn-bcd-collector.appspot.com/tests/api/WorkerGlobalScope
items.title: Add IE/Edge versions for WorkerGlobalScope API
